Desc.eng: Oh, that's great! Travelers! I was afraid I was going to have to spend the next century in this cave.
But you can ask others to help you out? It feels like cheating.
That's all? A clock? That shouldn't be a problem, kobolds or not.
Oh, joy! I suppose it comes at a price, though.
No. If it belonged to your elders, I won't ask anything from you. But our Resistance could use the help of a skilled engineer.
Actually, I was considering enlisting anyway. It's a disgrace what the people in charge committed in the name of Science down there. But I need that clockwork - then I'd be glad to help.
Why can’t you leave? Are you a demon bound to this place? Not that I mind, you know, I'm just being careful.
Heavens, no! I'm a humble engineer. I lost my mechanical aides, and I don’t dare to enter the inner caverns. It's swarming with kobolds.
And what prevents you from leaving the cave? A curse?
What's with you people? No! I've sworn an oath to retrieve a relic of my elders. It's an ancient clock, the first experiment in science and magic. It's somewhere here, and I can't leave without it.
This is your lucky day. We have your clockwork.
Oh, joy! I suppose it comes at a price, though.
No. If it belonged to your elders, I won't ask anything from you. But our Resistance could use the help of a skilled engineer.
Actually, I was considering enlisting anyway. It's a disgrace what the people in charge committed in the name of Science down there. I'd be glad to help.
